entry.title: The Download: Maintainer Month, .NET MAUI Goes GA, Flight Simulator: Top Gun, and more

media:group.media:title: The Download: Maintainer Month, .NET MAUI Goes GA, Flight Simulator: Top Gun, and more
media:group.media:description: On this episode of The Download, Christina is on location at RenderATL, but is still here to offer the latest developer news, including: 0:00 Intro 0:59 Maintainer Month https://github.blog/2022-06-01-welcome-to-maintainer-month/, https://maintainermonth.github.com https://maintainermonth.github.com and 1Password Podcast https://randombutmemorable.simplecast.com/episodes/open-source-lost-quest 1:53 Microsoft Build Updates https://news.microsoft.com/build-2022-book-of-news/ 2:10 GitHub Copilot GA and Free for Students/OSS https://techcrunch.com/2022/05/24/copilot-githubs-ai-powered-coding-tool-will-become-generally-available-this-summer/ 2:50 .NET MAUI Goes GA https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/introducing-dotnet-maui-one-codebase-many-platforms/, James's video course https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DuNLR_NJv8U and GitHub repo https://github.com/dotnet-presentations/dotnet-maui-workshop 3:54 Azure Static Web Apps CLI GA https://dev.to/azure/azure-static-web-apps-cli-is-now-ga-global-access-1714 and GitHub repo https://github.com/Azure/static-web-apps-cli 4:30 VideoGrep https://github.com/antiboredom/videogrep and tutorial https://lav.io/notes/videogrep-tutorial/ 5:43 **Christina's Pick of the Week**: Flight Simulator Top Gun Expansion https://www.flightsimulator.com/become-a-top-gun-pilot-in-free-expansion-available-today/ Presented by: @Christina Warren Shot by: @Helen Hou-Sandi As always, feel free to leave us a comment below and don't forget to subscribe: http://bit.ly/subgithub Thanks! Connect with us. Facebook: http://fb.com/github Twitter: http://twitter.com/github LinkedIn: http://linkedin.com/company/github About GitHub GitHub is the best place to share code with friends, co-workers, classmates, and complete strangers. Millions of people use GitHub to build amazing things together. For more info, go to http://github.com
